Key Match Events: Rishabh Pant scored 28 off 28 balls, the fastest half-century in T20 World Cup history.
Rishad Hossain took two crucial wickets in the middle overs.
Kuldeep Yadav took three key wickets in Bangladesh's chase.
Pre-Game Insights: India and Bangladesh were both aiming to secure their place in the semi-finals with a win.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's partnership was discussed as a key factor in India's batting approach.
Post-Match Reflections: India's coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their World Cup campaign.
Bangladesh's loss left them on the brink of elimination.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Antigua, and the slow pitch played a significant role in the outcome.
The match was the 47th of the Super Eights group in the tournament.
